website_summaries.verdict: A solid cordless trimmer that can help with tougher trimming situations. It has a saw at the tip and a power-through option.
pros: The long 24-inch blade gives you an extended reach
Both the POWERCUT feature and the saw blade at the tip are useful in handling branches that are too thick for other trimmers – up to 1.5 inches
The 60-volt MAX gives you the power to effortlessly cut through branches up to 0.75 inches
cons: The battery adds a couple of pounds to this trimmer, which is enough to move it beyond a lightweight tool

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer is fantastic--best yard tool I own
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of gardening in our overgrown yard, and I took a chance paying much more on this unit instead of cheaper corded or cordless ones. Now, after using it all over our yard on some pretty large, overgrown shrubs, I am so glad that I paid more for this powerful, cordless model. It works like a charm. Hasn't gotten stuck once on any good-sized branches. Mows through thick shrubs like butter. Very easy to operate and use. Worth every penny. (I think I'll carry on with this trend and get the Black & Decker heavy duty blower with the same battery; power is addictive....)
customer_reviews.author: DougH

customer_reviews.title: Great price and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: My B&D LHT360 hedge trimmer works great. I have a 1/4 acre yard landscaped with a number of bushes and plants that need trimming. I was concerned that the 60 volt battery wouldn't allow me to finish my trimming without a recharge but no problem. The trimmer doesn't have the power of my gas powered unit but it is lighter, better balanced and most importantly I don't have to inhale the exhaust fumes nor wash my body and clothes when I finish my work. In short, after doing my yard a couple of times, I'm very satisfied with this product. The trimmer is well made and priced very competitively when compared to other models and makes.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but well balanced. Trims bushes, hedges and small trees like they were grass.

It's very easy to get carried away - I'm used to a lot of resistance - my old trimmers were 12 volt and not neatly as powerful. So the first few times you use this, do it on an area that's as hidden as possible. It is heavy though!
